qas.question: What was written by the a all inclusive group convened by the holy church centered in Rome ?
What document did this group create once it was convened ?

answers.text: The report "Mary: Faith and Hope in Christ"

qas.question: What did the document attempt to clarify ?

answers.text: teaching about Mary in the two definitions

qas.question: What was the final conclusion reached in the report by the group ?

answers.text: Assumption and the Immaculate Conception can be said to be consonant with the teaching of the Scriptures and the ancient common traditions.

qas.question: What type of interpretation did the group believe was of concern in regard to Mary ?

answers.text: The question arises for Anglicans, however, as to whether these doctrines concerning Mary are revealed by God in a way which must be held

plausible_answers.text: can be said to be consonant with the teaching of the Scriptures and the ancient common traditions.

qas.question: What did the Roman Catholic Church conclude about the teaching on the Assumption and the Immaqculate Conception?

plausible_answers.text: the teaching of the Scriptures and the ancient common traditions

qas.question: According to the Anglicans what are the teachings on The Assumption and Immaculate conception not cosistant with?
What was 5the Roman Catholic church concerned with?
Who did The Anglicans say revealed these concepts?
What doctrine do Anlicans believe is a matte5r of faith?

context: <a1_0>The report "Mary: Faith and Hope in Christ"<a1_0/>, by the <a0_0>Anglican-Roman Catholic International Commission<a0_0/>, concluded that the <a2_0>teaching about Mary in the two definitions<a2_0/> of the <a3_0>Assumption and the Immaculate Conception <b5_0>can be said to be consonant with <b6_0>the teaching of the Scriptures and the ancient common traditions<b6_0/>.<b5_0/><a3_0/> But the report expressed concerns that the Roman Catholic <b7_0>dogmatic definitions of these concepts<b7_0/> implies them to be "revealed by <b8_0>God<b8_0/>", stating: "<a4_0>The question arises for Anglicans, however, as to whether these <b9_0>doctrines concerning Mary<b9_0/> are revealed by God in a way which must be held<a4_0/> by believers as a matter of faith."
